alert.note: Alert for Boone; Jasper; Marshall; Polk; Story; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 8:10AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Polk, Story, Marshall, southern Hardin, Jasper, eastern Boone, southeastern Hamilton and northern Warren Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 809 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Boone to near Norwalk. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Law Enforcement. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boone and Boone Speedway around 815 AM CDT. Ames, Pleasant Hill and Carlisle around 820 AM CDT. Ankeny, Saylorville, Gilbert and Iowa State Fairgrounds around 825 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Altoona, Bondurant, Story City, Prairie Meadows, Adventureland Amusement Park, Mitchellville, Roland, Colfax and Baxter. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 87 and 132. Interstate 80 between mile markers 127 and 177. Interstate 235 between mile markers 2 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Jasper; Marshall; Polk; Story; Warren
